{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3569849,"name":"Ambrish","username":"ambrish3281","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/ea666f/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-27T04:18:54.912Z","cooked":"

Hello,

We have an ARM which extends beyond chassis when it is laying down.
Is there a programmable way to achieve this in Robot Init time ?
Right now we can only lift it up once Teleop is enabled with some feed forward.

Thank you for your inputs!

-Ambrish

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-03-27T04:18:54.912Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":392,"readers_count":391,"score":103.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":497105,"topic_slug":"how-to-hold-arm-in-upright-position-at-the-starting-of-game","display_username":"Ambrish","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70872,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-to-hold-arm-in-upright-position-at-the-starting-of-game/497105/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3569851,"name":"Chadfrom7226","username":"Chadfrom7226","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chadfrom7226/{size}/113429_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-27T04:20:45.665Z","cooked":"

Can you turn brake mode on on the motors? Can you put a mechanical stop in that you can remove? Can you balance it?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-03-27T04:20:45.665Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":391,"readers_count":390,"score":78.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":497105,"topic_slug":"how-to-hold-arm-in-upright-position-at-the-starting-of-game","display_username":"Chadfrom7226","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20021,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-to-hold-arm-in-upright-position-at-the-starting-of-game/497105/2","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3569854,"name":"Ambrish","username":"ambrish3281","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/ea666f/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-27T04:25:02.410Z","cooked":"

When we just power on the Robot, my understanding is that all motors are disabled.
So not sure how to put it in brake mode.

Any leads/pointers for it ?

Thanks!

What motors are you using? You can do via app or in code.

ambrish3281:

We have an ARM which extends beyond chassis when it is laying down.

We have this same issue. To be within frame perimeter, we secure the arm up with a kickstand that spring loads out of the way once the arm moves when the robot is enabled.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-03-27T07:08:35.709Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":320,"readers_count":319,"score":129.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":497105,"topic_slug":"how-to-hold-arm-in-upright-position-at-the-starting-of-game","display_username":"Patrick Woolfenden","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30603,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2910 | swervedrive.com"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-hold-arm-in-upright-position-at-the-starting-of-game/497105/5","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3569925,"name":"John Hascall (he)","username":"john3928","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-27T09:31:43.740Z","cooked":"

I’ve seen teams just use masking/painter’s tape to hold something until the first time the motors move it and break the tape.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-03-27T09:31:43.740Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":274,"readers_count":273,"score":64.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":497105,"topic_slug":"how-to-hold-arm-in-upright-position-at-the-starting-of-game","display_username":"John Hascall (he)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":30603,"username":"PatrickW","name":"Patrick Woolfenden","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrickw/{size}/129934_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46267,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Opinions expressed are mine only"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-hold-arm-in-upright-position-at-the-starting-of-game/497105/6","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3569962,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-27T12:03:54.485Z","cooked":"

I’d done fishing line and well-tied rubber bands before, but never painter tape. Filing that one away.

The other thing I haven’t seen mentioned: a numerically higher gear ratio usually creates more friction in the system. At a suitably high ratio and with brake mode enabled on the motor controllers (how to do that varies by controller), even a fairly hefty arm can stay up. I don’t recall how much ours weighs all-in, but two NEOs at around 240:1 total reduction did the trick.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-03-27T12:03:54.485Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":230,"readers_count":229,"score":66.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":497105,"topic_slug":"how-to-hold-arm-in-upright-position-at-the-starting-of-game","display_username":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":46267,"username":"john3928","name":"John Hascall (he)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":3095,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"is recovering from IRI"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-hold-arm-in-upright-position-at-the-starting-of-game/497105/7","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3569974,"name":"Mr. Siefen | 453","username":"kingc95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kingc95/{size}/226662_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-27T12:30:37.178Z","cooked":"

For some smaller deadaxle arms, the snowblower hex motors with a single sprocket reduction like 16T to 48T in brake mode will hold the arm upright vertically, not sure about at 45° or a more difficult angle without active motor power and closed loop control.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-03-27T12:34:05.467Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":199,"readers_count":198,"score":39.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":497105,"topic_slug":"how-to-hold-arm-in-upright-position-at-the-starting-of-game","display_username":"Mr. Siefen | 453","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":3095,"username":"Billfred","name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20632,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mr. Siefen"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-hold-arm-in-upright-position-at-the-starting-of-game/497105/8","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3570025,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-27T13:40:06.699Z","cooked":"

As a very similar idea: I have used a tab of Velcro many times to hold an intake or other component in, this year included.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-03-27T13:41:09.944Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":158,"readers_count":157,"score":76.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":497105,"topic_slug":"how-to-hold-arm-in-upright-position-at-the-starting-of-game","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":46267,"username":"john3928","name":"John Hascall (he)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Flyin' a hull |5934←2451←2767←876"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-hold-arm-in-upright-position-at-the-starting-of-game/497105/9","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3570240,"name":"Ambrish","username":"ambrish3281","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/ea666f/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-27T17:24:28.919Z","cooked":"

Thanks everyone for the info! Really appreciate it.
We will try out suggestions and see which one works for us.

Thanks!
-Ambrish
